bug.short_desc: Please package version 5.6.10 of aqbanking to solve Comdirect issue

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: In a nutshell, certain Comdirect accounts can't be retrieved anymore, whereas they could in the past. See https://devel.aqbanking.de/trac/aqbanking/ticket/237 and https://devel.aqbanking.de/trac/aqbanking/ticket/249 for more details (https://devel.aqbanking.de/trac/aqbanking/ticket/237#comment:6 is from me and in English)
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 5.5.1
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. try to retrieve transactions from certain Comdirect accounts
Actual results: Aqbanking complains that the account doesn't support certain transactions (I don't go into the details because the solution is obvious, upgrade to the next version :-P).
Expected results: Account transactions can be downloaded.
Additional info:
According to https://devel.aqbanking.de/trac/aqbanking/ticket/237#comment:10 the issue is solved in version 5.6.5beta respectively 5.6.10.0 (see http://www2.aquamaniac.de/sites/download/packages.php?showall=1#03)
The bug is urgent because I can't download my transactions and they disappear after 90 days.
There is a report on gnucash-user of 5.6.10 breaking online banking in GnuCash entirely. Will require some investigation.

A limited backport of the one fix impacting me would be gratefully taken, but, yeah, better test thoroughly before releasing a broken package. (for the records, I'm using KMyMoney, let me know if you need some end-user testing for any "beta" package)

Sorry about the awful delay.
Coming to rawhide tomorrow-ish.

aqbanking-5.6.10-1.fc25 kmymoney-4.7.2-5.fc25
I tested it briefly in GnuCash with an online account and it was OK.

I've installed those packages on top of my fc24:
# dnf install fedora-repos-rawhide # dnf install kmymoney aqbanking --enablerepo rawhide [...] Upgraded: aqbanking.x86_64 5.6.10-1.fc25 kmymoney.x86_64 4.7.2-5.fc25 kmymoney-doc.noarch 4.7.2-5.fc25 kmymoney-libs.x86_64 4.7.2-5.fc25
and it looks OK so far: the first account sync went wrong like before, but the 2nd one seems to have worked (there was a remark somewhere that account capabilities are updated _after_ a sync).
Only _seems_ because I've got some strange duplicates of entries and accounts, but I think that's not related (got those before, even if they look really tough this time).
Need to go, but I keep you posted once I've progressed on my tests.
This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 25 development cycle. Changing version to '25'.

gnucash-2.6.14-1.fc24 kmymoney-4.7.2-5.fc24 aqbanking-5.6.12-1.fc24 gwenhywfar-4.15.3-2.fc24 gnucash-docs-2.6.14-1.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-29e231710b

aqbanking-5.6.12-1.fc24, gnucash-2.6.14-1.fc24, gnucash-docs-2.6.14-1.fc24, gwenhywfar-4.15.3-2.fc24, kmymoney-4.7.2-5.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-29e231710b

aqbanking-5.6.12-1.fc24, gnucash-2.6.14-1.fc24, gnucash-docs-2.6.14-1.fc24, gwenhywfar-4.15.3-2.fc24, kmymoney-4.7.2-5.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
